text:
TikTok visionary Alex
will be competing
in the Sock Slide

against three
amazing Olympians
I'm no Olympian,

but I've been doing
a lot of training myself.
[jazz music]
- Hi, I'm Seth MacFarlane

and welcome to the Peacock
"At-Home Variety Show,"

benefitting great organizations
like Americares,

Feeding America,
and United Way,

all of whom are working
very hard

to assist those in need
during this pandemic.

Well, tonight, we have
a very special treat for you.
These are the Quarantine Games,

real-life Olympians competing
in their own homes.

You know them from their
incredible feats of athleticism
in the Olympics,
but now here they are

as you've never seen them
before:
pale and exhausted.

Folks,
here are the Quarantine Games.

- Good evening.
I'm Mike Tirico.

With the 2020 Tokyo Olympics
postponed,

the U.S. athletes who were
gonna star this summer,

they have been forced to train
in quarantine.
So these athletes,

along with fans
around the country,

remain hungry for some type
of competition.
- Fruit ninja!

- Enter TikTok star
Alex Presley and his family,

who've been taking on a series
of at-home challenges

that have been taking
the internet by storm.
[all cheering]

Tonight, Alex will represent
Team Presley

as he faces off against three
Team USA Olympians

in our first event,
the Sock Slide Challenge.

Welcome
to the 2020 Quarantine Games.
[upbeat rock music]

Tonight, TikTok visionary Alex
will be competing
in the Sock Slide

against three
amazing Olympians:

speed skater Brittany Bowe,
the Florida native

who took home a bronze
in Pyeongchang,
diver Steele Johnson,

a five-time NCA champ
for Purdue

who earned a silver medal
in the 2016 Rio games,

and two-time
Olympic gold medalist
Mikaela Shiffrin,

the alpine skier
who, last year,

broke the record
for the most World Cup wins
in a single season.

- I'm up against
some fierce competitors.
I'm no Olympian,

but I've been doing
a lot of training myself.

I've been drinking carrots
for four straight weeks.
A 70/30 polyester-cotton blend.

It is the perfect combination
for sliding distance.

Been doing these
four times a day.
Help!

- It's going to be
a fierce matchup tonight.

The heat is on
and the shoes are off

as these athletes prepare
for this historic event.
- Okay, I got this.

- Alex is looking
very confident
in those poly blend socks.
I wouldn't mess with Mikaela.
She's got her game face on.
These competitors came to win.
[exciting music]

- Come on, Alex!
- Come on, big guy!
- They're on their marks.
And they're off,

just gliding
across those floors
like human Swiffers.

It's hard to tell
just who won.

It's gonna come down
to the tale of the tape.

First up,
let's take a look at Alex.

You can tell
he was really loving
the support of the crowd.

He winds up.
Great form.

Really just flying
across the floor.

And the Argyle Annihilator
comes in at 180 inches,

an impressive slide
for the non-Olympian.

Brittany came in
looking very focused.

She might've had an advantage
with this speed skater form.

Here she comes
to the start line

and wow,
that is one heck of a slide.

She clocks in
at a solid 184 inches.

Skier Mikaela had
a different approach
with a long takeoff.

Let's see if it got her
the distance she needed
to take the lead.

It looks like she might have--
and yes.

It's in
at a whopping 191 inches.

Can diver Steele Johnson
beat that?

Looks like he got
some great traction
on that takeoff
and look at him go.
An amazing slide.

He almost went
straight through the wall.

Let's see where this lands him
on the leaderboard.
229 inches.
Steele takes the gold.

["The Star-Spangled Banner"
playing]
- Oh!

Hey, sorry, dude.
- It's okay, Alex.

- You know what?
You tried your best.
- It's all right, man.
- 19 feet 1 1/2 inches.

Perfect enough
to secure the gold medal.

Sorry to my other competitors,
but this time, I won.

- What a matchup.
What a night.
Hope you tune in next week

for week two
of Quarantine Games.

Until then, I'm Mike Tirico.
Good night.

And a reminder, you can watch
the Tokyo Olympics
next summer on NBC.
- Three payments.
Genuine polyester.
- [laughs]
- Just goofing.
New sock goofing.
[jazz music]
